olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: NVLink not functional
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: NPUisnInvalid
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: NPU[0-9]+: isn 0x[0-9a-f]+ not valid for this NPU

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Firmware probably ran out of memory creating NPU slot. NVLink functionality could be broken.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: NPUCannotCreatePHBSlot

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: OPAL failed to add the power-mgt device tree node. This could mean that firmware ran out of memory, or there's a bug somewhere.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: CreateDTPowerMgtNodeFail

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: An error condition occurred in sleep/winkle engines timer state machine. Dumping debug information to root-cause. OPAL/skiboot may be stuck on some operation that requires SLW timer state machine (e.g. core powersaving)
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: SLWRegisterDump

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: The SLeep/Winkle Engine (SLW) failed to increment the generation number within our timeout period (it *should* have done so within ~10us, not >1ms. OPAL uses the SLW timer to schedule some operations, but can fall back to the (much less frequent OPAL poller, which although does not affect functionality, runs *much* less frequently. This could have the effect of slow I2C operations (for example). It may also mean that you *had* an increase in jitter, due to slow interactions with SLW. This error may also occur if the machine is connected to via soft FSI.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: SLWTimerStuck
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: SLW: timer stuck, falling back to OPAL pollers. You will likely have slower I2C and may have experienced increased jitter.

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: No GPU/NPU slot information was found. NVLink2 functionality will not work.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: NPUNoPHBSlotLabel
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: NPU: Cannot find GPU slot information

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Firmware probably ran out of memory creating NPU slot. NVLink functionality could be broken.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: NPUCannotCreatePHBSlot

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: OPAL marked a Centaur (memory buffer) as offline due to CENTAUR_ERR_OFFLINE_THRESHOLD (10) consecutive errors on XSCOMs to this centaur. OPAL will now return OPAL_XSCOM_CTR_OFFLINED and not try any further XSCOMs. This is likely caused by some hardware issue or PRD recovery issue.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: CentaurOfflinedTooManyErrors
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: CENTAUR: Offlined [0-9a-f]+ due to > [0-9]+ consecutive XSCOM errors. No more XSCOMs to this centaur.

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: xscom_read was called with an invalid partid. There's likely a bug somewhere in the stack that's causing someone to try an xscom_read on something that isn't a processor, Centaur or EX chiplet.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: XSCOMReadInvalidPartID

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: xscom_write was called with an invalid partid. There's likely a bug somewhere in the stack that's causing someone to try an xscom_write on something that isn't a processor, Centaur or EX chiplet.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: XSCOMWriteInvalidPartID

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: The HOMER base address for a chip was not valid. This means that OCC (On Chip Controller) will be non-functional and CPU frequency scaling will not be functional. CPU may be set to a safe, low frequency. Power savings in CPU idle or CPU hotplug may be impacted.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: OCCInvalidHomerBase
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: OCC: Chip: [0-9a-f]+ homer_base is not valid

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: The pstate table for a chip was not valid. This means that OCC (On Chip Controller) will be non-functional and CPU frequency scaling will not be functional. CPU may be set to a low, safe frequency. This means that CPU idle states and CPU frequency scaling may not be functional.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: OCCInvalidPStateTable
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: OCC: Chip: [0-9a-f]+ PState table is not valid

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: The pstate table for the first chip was not valid. This means that OCC (On Chip Controller) will be non-functional. This means that CPU idle states and CPU frequency scaling will not be functional as OPAL doesn't populate the device tree with pstates in this case.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: OCCInvalidPStateTableDT
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: OCC: PState table is not valid

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: The PState table layout version is not supported in P9. So OPAL will not parse the PState table. CPU frequency scaling will not be functional as frequency and pstate-ids are not added to DT.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: OCCInvalidVersion02
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: OCC: Version [0-9a-f]+ is not supported in P9

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: The PState table layout version is not supported in P8. So OPAL will not parse the PState table. CPU frequency scaling will not be functional as frequency and pstate-ids are not added to DT.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: OCCInvalidVersion90
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: OCC: Version [0-9a-f]+ is not supported in P8

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: The PState table layout version is not supported. So OPAL will not parse the PState table. CPU frequency scaling will not be functional as OPAL doesn't populate the device tree with pstates.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: OCCUnsupportedVersion
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: OCC: Unsupported pstate table layout version [0-9]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: The min pstate is greater than the max pstate, this could be due to corrupted/invalid data in OCC-OPAL shared memory region. So OPAL has not added pstates to device tree. This means that CPU Frequency management will not be functional in the host.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: OCCInvalidPStateLimits
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: OCC: Invalid pstate limits. Pmin([0-9]+) > Pmax ([0-9]+)

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: The nominal pstate is greater than the max pstate, this could be due to corrupted/invalid data in OCC-OPAL shared memory region. So OPAL has limited the nominal pstate to max pstate.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: OCCInvalidNominalPState
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: OCC: Clipping nominal pstate([0-9]+) to Pmax([0-9]+)

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: The number of pstates is outside the valid range (currently <=1 or > 128), so OPAL has not added pstates to the device tree. This means that OCC (On Chip Controller) will be non-functional. This means that CPU idle states and CPU frequency scaling will not be functional.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: OCCInvalidPStateRange
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: OCC: OCC range is not valid; No of pstates = [0-9]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Device tree node /ibm,opal/power-mgt not found. OPAL didn't add pstate information to device tree. Probably a firmware bug.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: OCCDTNodeNotFound

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to create /ibm,opal/power-mgt/occ. Per-chip pstate properties are not added to Device Tree.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: OCCDTFailedNodeCreation

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: ENOMEM while allocating OCC load message. OCCs not started, consequently no power/frequency scaling will be functional.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: OCCload_reqENOMEM

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Invalid request for loading OCCs. Power and frequency management not functional
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: OCCLoadInvalidScope
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: OCC: Load message with invalid scope 0x[0-9a-f]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Invalid request for resetting OCCs. Power and frequency management not functional
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: OCCResetInvalidScope
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: OCC: Reset message with invalid scope 0x[0-9a-f]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: OPAL had trouble creating the sensor nodes in the device tree as there was already one there. This indicates either the device tree from Hostboot already filled in sensors or an OPAL bug.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: OPALSensorNodeExists

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to update System Attention Indicator. Likely means some bug with OPAL interacting with FSP.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: FSPSAIFailed

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: OPAL ran out of memory while trying to allocate an FSP message in SAI code path. This indicates an OPAL bug that caused OPAL to run out of memory.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: SAIMallocFail

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Error in queueing message to FSP in SAI code path. Likely an OPAL bug.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: SAIQueueFail

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Possibly an error on FSP side, OPAL failed to read state from FSP.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: FSPSAIGetFailed

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: OPAL ran out of memory: OPAL bug.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: FSPGetSAIMallocFail

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Failed to queue message to FSP: OPAL bug
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: FSPGetSAIQueueFail

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: OPAL failed to allocate memory for FSP LED command. Likely an OPAL bug led to out of memory.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: FSPLEDRequestMallocFail
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: SPCN set command node allocation failed

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Inconsistent state between OPAL and FSP in code path for handling failure of fetching error log from FSP. Likely a bug in interaction between FSP and OPAL.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: ElogFetchFailureInconsistent

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Bug in interaction between FSP and OPAL. We expected there to be a pending read from FSP but the list was empty.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: ElogQueueInconsistent

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: We expected there to be an entry in the list of error logs for the error log we're fetching information for. There wasn't. This means there's a bug.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: ElogInfoInconsistentState

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Inconsistent state while reading error log from FSP. Bug in OPAL and FSP interaction.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: ElogReadInconsistentState

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Error in acknowledging heartbeat to FSP. This could mean the FSP has gone away or it may mean the FSP may kill us for missing too many heartbeats.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: FSPHeartbeatAckError
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: SURV: Heartbeat Acknowledgment error from FSP

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Bug in interaction between FSP and OPAL. The state maintained by OPAL didn't match what the FSP sent.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: ElogListInconsistent

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Bug in skiboot/FSP code for EPOW event handling
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: EPOWSignatureMismatch

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Queueing a message from OPAL to FSP failed. This is likely due to either an OPAL bug or the FSP going away.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: EPOWMessageQueueFailed

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: OPAL doesn't know that the BMC supports PNOR access commands. This will be a bug in the OPAL support for this BMC.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: PNORAccessYeahButNoBut
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: PNOR BUG: access requested but BMC doesn't support request

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: In negotiating PNOR access with BMC, we got an odd/invalid request from the BMC. Likely a bug in OPAL/BMC interaction.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: InvalidPNORAccessRequest

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Likely bug in what sent us the OCC reset.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: SELUnknownOCCReset
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: SEL message to reset an unknown OCC (sensor ID 0x[0-9a-f]+)

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: The resource is not registered in the resource_map[] array, but it should be otherwise the resource cannot be measured if trusted mode is on.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: STBMeasureResourceNotMapped

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Null resource passed to tb_measure. This has come from the resource load framework and likely indicates a bug in the framework.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: STBNullResourceReceived

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Unregistered resources can be verified, but not measured. The resource should be registered in the resource_map[] array, otherwise the resource cannot be measured if trusted mode is on.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: STBVerifyResourceNotMapped

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: STB_DEBUG should not be enabled in production. PCR read operation failed. This TSS implementation is part of hostboot, but the source code is shared with skiboot. 1) The hostboot TSS may have been updated. 2) This may be caused by the short I2C timeout and can be fixed by increasing the timeout. Otherwise this indicates a bug in the TSS or the TPM device driver. Each one has local debug macros that can help.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: STBPCRReadFailed
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: STB: tpmCmdPcrRead() failed: tpm[0-9]+, alg=[0-9a-f]+, pcr[0-9]+, rc=[0-9]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: TPM node already registered. The same node is being registered twice or there is a tpm node duplicate in the device tree
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMAlreadyRegistered

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: linux,sml-base property not found. This indicates a Hostboot bug if the property really doesn't exist in the tpm node.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMSmlBaseNotFound
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: TPM: linux,sml-base property not found tpm node (0x[0-9a-f]+|nil)

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: linux,sml-size property not found. This indicates a Hostboot bug if the property really doesn't exist in the tpm node.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMSmlSizeNotFound
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: TPM: linux,sml-size property not found, tpm node (0x[0-9a-f]+|nil)

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Hostboot creates and adds entries to the event log. The failed init function is part of hostboot, but the source code is shared with skiboot. If the hostboot TpmLogMgr code (or friends) has been updated, the changes need to be applied to skiboot as well.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMInitEventLogFailed
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: TPM: eventlog init failed: tpm[0-9]+ rc=[0-9]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: TPM already initialized. Check if tpm is being initialized more than once.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMAlreadyInitialized

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: No TPM chip has been initialized. We may not have a compatible tpm driver or there is no tpm node in the device tree with the expected bindings.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: NoTPMRegistered

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: TpmLogMgr failed to add a new event to the event log. TpmLogMgr is part of hostboot, but the source code is shared with skiboot. 1) The hostboot TpmLogMgr code may have been updated. 2) Check that max event log size was not reached and log marshall executed with no error. Enabling the trace routines in trustedbootUtils.H may help.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: STBAddEventFailed
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: TPM: .* -> elog[0-9]+ FAILED: pcr[0-9]+ et=[0-9a-f]+ rc=[0-9]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: PCR extend operation failed. This TSS implementation is part of hostboot, but the source code is shared with skiboot. 1) The hostboot TSS may have been updated. 2) This may be caused by the short I2C timeout and can be fixed by increasing the timeout. Otherwise, this indicates a bug in the TSS or the TPM device driver. Each one has local debug macros that can help.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: STBPCRExtendFailed

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: ibm,secureboot already registered. Check if rom_init called twice or the same driver is probed twice
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: ROMAlreadyRegistered

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Either the tpm device or the tpm-i2c interface doesn't seem to be working properly. Check the return code (rc) for further details.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMReadCmdReady
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: NUVOTON: fail to read sts.commandReady, rc=[0-9]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Either the tpm device or the tpm-i2c interface doesn't seem to be working properly. Check the return code (rc) for further details.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMWriteCmdReady
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: NUVOTON: fail to write sts.commandReady, rc=[0-9]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: The command ready bit of the tpm status register is taking longer to be settled. Either the wait time need to be increased or the TPM device is not functional.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMCmdReadyTimeout

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Either the tpm device or the tpm-i2c interface doesn't seem to be working properly. Check the return code (rc) for further details.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMReadFifoStatus
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: NUVOTON: fail to read fifo status: mask [0-9a-f]+, expected [0-9a-f]+, rc=[0-9]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Either the tpm device or the tpm-i2c interface doesn't seem to be working properly. Check the return code (rc) for further details.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMReadDataAvail
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: NUVOTON: fail to read sts.dataAvail, rc=[0-9]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: The data avail bit of the tpm status register is taking longer to be settled. Either the wait time need to be increased or the TPM device is not functional.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMDataAvailBitTimeout

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Either the tpm device or the tpm-i2c interface doesn't seem to be working properly. Check the return code (rc) for further details.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMReadBurstCount
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: NUVOTON: fail to read sts.burstCount, rc=[0-9]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: The burstcount bit of the tpm status register is taking longer to be settled. Either the wait time need to be increased or the TPM device is not functional.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMBurstCountTimeout

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Either the tpm device or the tpm-i2c interface doesn't seem to be working properly. Check the return code (rc) for further details.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMWriteFifo
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: NUVOTON: fail to write fifo, count=[0-9]+, rc=[0-9]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: The write to the TPM FIFO overflowed, the TPM is not expecting more data. This indicates a bug in the TPM device driver.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMWriteFifoNotExpecting
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: NUVOTON: write FIFO overflow, not expecting more data

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Either the tpm device or the tpm-i2c interface doesn't seem to be working properly. Check the return code (rc) for further details.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMWriteFifoLastByte
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: NUVOTON: fail to write fifo (last byte), count=[0-9]+, rc=[0-9]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: The write to the TPM FIFO overflowed. It is expecting more data even though we think we are done. This indicates a bug in the TPM device driver.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMWriteFifoExpecting
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: TPM: write FIFO overflow, expecting more data

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: The read from TPM FIFO overflowed. It is expecting more data even though we think we are done. This indicates a bug in the TPM device driver.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMReadFifoOverflow
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: NUVOTON: overflow on fifo read, c=[0-9]+, bc=[0-9]+, bl=[0-9]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Either the tpm device or the tpm-i2c interface doesn't seem to be working properly. Check the return code (rc) for further details.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMReadFifo
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: NUVOTON: fail to read fifo, count=[0-9]+, rc=[0-9]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: TPM device is not initialized. This indicates a bug in the tpm_transmit() caller
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMDeviceNotInitialized

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Either the tpm device or the tpm-i2c interface doesn't seem to be working properly. Check the return code (rc) for further details.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMWriteGo
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: NUVOTON: fail to write sts.go, rc=[0-9]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Either the tpm device or the tpm-i2c interface doesn't seem to be working properly. Check the return code (rc) for further details.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMReleaseTpm
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: NUVOTON: fail to release tpm, rc=[0-9]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Hostboot creates the ibm,secureboot node and the hash-algo property. Check that the ibm,secureboot node layout has not changed.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: ROMHashAlgorithmInvalid

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: tpm_i2c_request_send was passed an invalid bus ID. This indicates a tb_init() bug.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMI2CInvalidBusID

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: OPAL failed to allocate memory for an i2c_request. This points to an OPAL bug as OPAL run out of memory and this should never happen.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: TPMI2CAllocationFailed

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Hostboot creates the ibm,secureboot node and the hash-algo property. Check that the ibm,secureboot node layout has not changed.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: ROMHashAlgorithmInvalid

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: opal_i2c_request was passed an invalid bus ID. This has likely come from the OS rather than OPAL and thus could indicate an OS bug rather than an OPAL bug.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: I2CInvalidBusID
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: I2C: Invalid 'bus_id' passed to the OPAL

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: OPAL failed to allocate memory for an i2c_request. This points to an OPAL bug as OPAL ran out of memory and this should never happen.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: I2CFailedAllocation

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: HBRT triggered assert: you need to debug HBRT
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: HBRTassert

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Firmware should have aborted boot
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: HBRTlidLoadFail

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: You are running in manufacturing mode. This mode should only be enabled in a factory during manufacturing.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: ManufacturingMode

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: OPAL could not find an NVRAM partition on the system flash. Check that the system flash has a valid partition table, and that the firmware build process has added a NVRAM partition.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: NVRAMNoPartition
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: FLASH: Can't parse ffs info for NVRAM

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: OPAL Found multiple system flash. Since we've already found a system flash we are going to use that one but this ordering is not guaranteed so may change in future.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: SystemFlashMultiple
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: FLASH: Attempted to register multiple system flash: .*

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: System flash isn't formatted as expected. This could mean several OPAL utilities do not function as expected. e.g. gard, pflash.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: NoFFS
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: FLASH: No ffs info; using raw device only

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: No system flash was found. Check for missing calls flash_register(...).
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: SystemFlashNotFound
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: FLASH: Can't load resource id:[0-9]+. No system flash found

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: OPAL was called with a bad token. On POWER8 and earlier, Linux kernels had a bug where they wouldn't check if firmware supported particular OPAL calls before making them. It is, in fact, harmless for these cases. On systems newer than POWER8, this should never happen and indicates a kernel bug where OPAL_CHECK_TOKEN isn't being called where it should be.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: OPALBadToken

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Currently removing a poller is DANGEROUS and MUST NOT be done in production firmware.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: UnsupportedOPALdelpoller
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: WARNING: Unsupported opal_del_poller. Interesting locking issues, don't call this.

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Recursion detected in opal_run_pollers(). This indicates a bug in OPAL where a poller ended up running pollers, which doesn't lead anywhere good.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: OPALPollerRecursion

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: opal_run_pollers() was called with a lock held, which could lead to deadlock if not excessively lucky/careful.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: OPALPollerWithLock

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Your firmware is buggy, see the 64 messages complaining about opal_run_pollers with lock held.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: OPALPollerWithLock64
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: opal_run_pollers with lock run 64 times, disabling warning.

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: OPAL will parse the Flattened Device Tree(FDT), which can be generated from different firmware sources. During expansion of FDT, OPAL observed a node assigned multiple times (a duplicate). This indicates either a Hostboot bug *OR*, more likely, a bug in the platform XML. Check the platform XML for duplicate IDs for this type of device. Because of this duplicate node, OPAL won't add the hardware device found with a duplicate node ID into DT, rendering the corresponding device not functional.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: DTHasDuplicateNodeID

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: OPAL hit an assert(). During normal usage (even testing) we should never hit an assert. There are other code paths for controlled shutdown/panic in the event of catastrophic errors.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: FailedAssert

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Device tree didn't contain enough information to correctly report back PCI inventory. Service processor is likely to be missing information about what hardware is physically present in the machine.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: FirenzePCIInventory
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: No chip device node for PHB[0-9a-f]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: More PCI inventory than we can send to service processor. The service processor will have an incomplete view of the world.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: FirenzePCIInventoryTooLarge

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Error communicating with service processor when sending PCI Inventory.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: FirenzePCIInventoryError

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: On Firenze platforms, I2C is used to control power to PCI slots. Errors here mean we may be in trouble in regards to PCI slot power on/off.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: FirenzePCII2CError
olog_error_warning_patterns.pattern: Error [0-9]+ from I2C request on slot [0-9a-f]+

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Likely a coding error: invalid I2C request.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: FirenzePCII2CInvalid

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: The Firenze platform uses I2C to control power to PCI slots. Something went wrong in the state machine controlling that. Slots may/may not have power.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: FirenzePCISlotI2CStateError

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Unexpected state in the FIRENZE PCI Slot state machine. This could mean PCI is not functioning correctly.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: FirenzePCISlotGPowerState

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: Unexpected state in the FIRENZE PCI Slot state machine. This could mean PCI is not functioning correctly.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: FirenzePCISlotSPowerState

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: AST BMC is likely to be non-functional when accessed from host.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: ASTBMCFailedSetEnables

olog_error_warning_patterns.advice: HDAT described an invalid size for timebase, which means there's a disagreement between HDAT and OPAL. This is most certainly a firmware bug.
olog_error_warning_patterns.label: HDATBadTimebaseSize
